strapiPost.title: Weekend Roundup
strapiPost.content:
Another eventful weekend ahead! Here are some happenings we think are worth looking into:

  • Biking: The Square 2 Square Bike Ride is finally here on Saturday!
  • Fresh: The Rogers Local Food Market opens for the 2022 season tomorrow! Go stock up on some fresh produce and other goods. 
  • Charity: There will be a Make-A-Wish “Walk for Wishes” fundraising event at Arvest Ballpark this weekend.
  • Growth: The Shiloh Museum of Ozark History is debuting its new seed library on Saturday from 9-11a. 
  • Stepping: Get your Latin dance on at Java Dudes Coffee Co this weekend. 
  • On the stage: Go see a girl-powered comedy set during the French Revolution this weekend at The Victory Theater. 
  • Dress up: Bentonville GeekCon is back for 2022 at the Bentonville Public Library this Saturday.
  • Muddy: Time to get your hands dirty, because the Arkansas Pottery Festival is today starting at 10a!
  • Booths: The Little Craft Show will be at the Pavilion on Shiloh Square tomorrow.
  • For the moms: There’s a Mother’s Day pickleball tournament at PB&JJ’s on Sunday.
  • Music: Artosphere is happening all over NWA, but that’s only a snippet of the live music shows this weekend. Find who you want to go see, here.

Be safe, and we'll see you Monday!
